content.question: A glass lens with an index of refraction of <math alttext="1.50" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.50</mn></math> has a thin coating of film with an index of refraction of <math alttext="1.40" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.40</mn></math> on the top surface of the lens, as shown in the figure. When light of wavelength <math alttext="700 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mn>700</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>nm</mi></math> is incident on the film normal to the surface, there is maximum destructive interference between the light reflected from the air-film and film-glass interfaces. What is the minimum possible thickness of the film?
